attributes.action: Stop or suspend the practice of MP's referring to themselves as "Honourable" or "Right Honourable" Members.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
How can members of the House of Commons (MP's) still have the affront to refer to themselves as "The Honourable" or "Right Honourable" Member. 
The MP’s expense scandal makes this a farce. Using our money to fill their pockets, ducking out of paying tax, paying family members, and claiming for items not relevant to office is far from “Honourable”-The Public are sick and tired of hearing MP’s saying they did nothing wrong or “it was a mistake”.

The honourable thing to do would be to admit it and pay it all back.

With the Police now investigating MP’s expenses and prosecutions likely to follow how can they continue to be described as “Honourable”.

Consider this, The Honourable Member was today convicted of fraud and sentenced to 3 years.- The Right Honourable Member was convicted of obtaining public funds by deceit.


 “Honourable member” should be a term denoting respect and integrity – Are any of the members now serving in the House of Commons deserving of this.

Please sign this petition. If this petition gains momentum the Prime Minister and all MP’s will have a wake up call that can’t be ignored.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with Parliament: http://www.parliament.uk/
reasons: Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
